main_definition: To cause or allow to go or be taken somewhere, typically by some mode of transportation or communication.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To dispatch someone or something for a specific purpose or task.
meanings_and_examples.example: The manager will send an assistant to handle the customer's complaint.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To cause an object, message, or signal to move from one place to another through physical transportation.
meanings_and_examples.example: He sent his car keys with a friend so he wouldn't be late for work.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To transmit information, messages, or signals electronically, typically via the internet or phone lines.
meanings_and_examples.example: She sends an email to her colleagues every morning with updates on the project.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To give something to someone as a gift or token of appreciation.
meanings_and_examples.example: For his birthday, she sent him a bouquet of flowers and chocolates.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To entrust with the care or management of another person's affairs temporarily.
meanings_and_examples.example: The president sent one of his advisors to negotiate trade deals on behalf of the country.
